Gordon Paynter wrote:

> Hi again:
>
>
> >>> stack@... 09/14/05 3:28 p.m. >>>
> >> It should be fairly straightforward to write a program that reads a
> >> set of ARC files, grabs the HTML Pages, tweaks the links, writes them
> >> to an HTTrack-like browsable directory tree. Does anyone know if such
> >> a program already exists?
> >
> > There isn't one that we know of.  We'd love to have one.
>
> I'm writing a perl script to do this.  It currently uses BAT to read 
> the archives and builds a directory tree. I'm about to start work a 
> URL-mangling phase (i.e. converting all URLs in the page into relative 
> links to local files).  I can post a copy when I'm done if anyone is 
> interested.

Please do.
St.Ack
